title: Birthstone Quiz
description: Can you match each month to its birthstone?

questions.question: What is the birthstone for the month of January?
questions.explanation: Garnet is the birthstone for January. The word garnet comes from the Latin 'granatum,' meaning pomegranate seed, due to its deep red color.

questions.question: Which month has diamond as its birthstone?
questions.explanation: Diamond is the birthstone for April. Diamonds are the hardest natural material on Earth, scoring 10 on the Mohs hardness scale.

questions.question: What is the birthstone for December?
questions.explanation: Turquoise is the traditional birthstone for December (along with tanzanite and zircon). Turquoise has been prized for thousands of years in many cultures.

questions.question: Ruby is the birthstone for which month?
questions.explanation: Ruby is the birthstone for July. Rubies are among the most valued gemstones and symbolize passion and protection.

questions.question: What is the birthstone for June?
questions.explanation: Pearl is the traditional birthstone for June (along with alexandrite and moonstone). Pearls are unique among gemstones because they are formed inside living organisms.

questions.question: Emerald is the birthstone for which month?
questions.explanation: Emerald is the birthstone for May. Emeralds get their green color from trace amounts of chromium and sometimes vanadium.

questions.question: What is the birthstone for February?
questions.explanation: Amethyst is the birthstone for February. It is a purple variety of quartz and was once considered as precious as diamonds.

questions.question: Which month has sapphire as its birthstone?
questions.explanation: Sapphire is the birthstone for September. While most commonly associated with blue, sapphires actually come in every color except red.

questions.question: What is the birthstone for October?
questions.explanation: Opal is the traditional birthstone for October (along with tourmaline). Opals are known for their unique play-of-color, displaying a rainbow of hues.

questions.question: Aquamarine is the birthstone for which month?
questions.explanation: Aquamarine is the birthstone for March. Its name comes from the Latin for 'water of the sea,' reflecting its blue-green color.

questions.question: What is the birthstone for August?
questions.explanation: Peridot is the birthstone for August (along with spinel and sardonyx). Peridot is one of few gemstones found in only one color â€” a distinctive olive green.

questions.question: Which gemstone is the birthstone for November?
questions.explanation: Citrine is a birthstone for November (along with topaz). Citrine is a variety of quartz ranging from pale yellow to brownish orange.

questions.question: Which of these gemstones is NOT a traditional birthstone for any month?
questions.explanation: Jade is not a traditional birthstone for any month. While jade is highly valued in many cultures, particularly in Asia, it is not part of the modern birthstone list.

questions.question: Tanzanite is a modern birthstone for which month?
questions.explanation: Tanzanite was added as a modern birthstone for December in 2002. It was discovered in Tanzania in 1967 and is found nowhere else on Earth.

questions.question: Which birthstone is the hardest on the Mohs scale?
questions.explanation: Diamond (April's birthstone) is the hardest natural substance on Earth with a rating of 10 on the Mohs hardness scale. Ruby and sapphire both rate 9.
